0c3daaef85c19f5c3e46bc5f1989ee77.name: Authorization Failure Reporting
0c3daaef85c19f5c3e46bc5f1989ee77.description: Operations with restricted access report when authorization is denied in the form of a helpful error message.

49484f811a0685e566d30f2bb0c366bb.name: Configure SDK to authorize all requests using a specific access token
49484f811a0685e566d30f2bb0c366bb.description: After an SDK instance is created, an access token can be provided which will be used for all future operations requiring an authorization check.

2c33be0dc34fc31630f86f9ea5200946.name: Inspect the access token which the SDK is using to authorize requests
2c33be0dc34fc31630f86f9ea5200946.description: The access token which the SDK can use to authorize requests can be inspected. This may be useful in debugging or troubleshooting scenarios. This operation is known as `getToken`

fc6c498d2d86d21d24b32d6b49944654.name: Grant an access token
fc6c498d2d86d21d24b32d6b49944654.description: As a PubNub customer I want to restrict and allow access to specific PubNub resources (channels, channel groups, uuids) by my user base (both people and devices) which are each identified by a unique UUID.

960f98cc9286b75871db01397bacb186.name: Parse Access Token
960f98cc9286b75871db01397bacb186.description: Although clients do not need to know the internal details of how an access token is constructed, it can be helpful to have the ability to parse this internal structure to help with debugging and troubleshooting access issues.

9cd4c8809e3f376bdc0d41d8a3694ee9.name: Revoke an access token
9cd4c8809e3f376bdc0d41d8a3694ee9.description: As a PubNub customer I want to withdraw existing permission for specific PubNub resources by revoking corresponding tokens.

1f8b452724077879725454e9af577e99.name: provide an access token to the the SDK to authorize requests
1f8b452724077879725454e9af577e99.description: An access token can be provided which will be used for all future operations requiring an authorization check. This operation is known as `setToken`

2538da2e47f0f4e23c573fc847c6acaf.name: Message encryption
2538da2e47f0f4e23c573fc847c6acaf.description: As a PubNub user I want to be able to receive and decrypt messages So I can send confidential information throught PubNub network

8f3fe7bfcc733e7c46314c53f0c3c1a8.name: Send a file to Space
8f3fe7bfcc733e7c46314c53f0c3c1a8.description: As a PubNub user I want to send a file to Space with message type. Client should be able to pass optional spaceId and messageType to the File endpoint.

91f3a2c0e4424c87689525da44c4db11.name: Files
91f3a2c0e4424c87689525da44c4db11.description: As a PubNub user I want to upload, manage and download files So my customers can share files

efd56bc133990dba6fb78d8ed3345948.name: History for VSP
efd56bc133990dba6fb78d8ed3345948.description: As a PubNub user I want to fetch history with message type and space id information. Client should be able to opt-out default `includeMessageType` and specify whether space id should be returned with `includeSpaceId`.

16d2b386b2034b9488996466aaae0b57.name: History
16d2b386b2034b9488996466aaae0b57.description: As a PubNub user I want to get message history So I can display past messages

bfc34cd74d1dab63536a80aebfe3dc7e.name: Message Actions
bfc34cd74d1dab63536a80aebfe3dc7e.description: As a PubNub user I want to add, fetch and remove message actions So I can add features to my application like read receipts or reactions

86a052365207542b400a5a2afa08025c.name: Objects V2 Channel metadata
86a052365207542b400a5a2afa08025c.description: As a PubNub customer I want to create, update, remove channels.

f904be085f84e4dd964d64b101fe5673.name: Objects V2 Members
f904be085f84e4dd964d64b101fe5673.description: As a PubNub customer I want to create, get, remove and update channel members(UUIDs).

28ce82f5aa5c139169ffec2eef237027.name: Objects V2 Memberships
28ce82f5aa5c139169ffec2eef237027.description: As a PubNub customer I want to create, update, remove channels.

8a383f24948b75233e7a80e59607ce99.name: Objects V2 UUID metadata
8a383f24948b75233e7a80e59607ce99.description: As a PubNub customer I want to create, update, remove uuids.

ecb96f0fb94cc64370cd3d01a5c2d2bb.name: Get presence state
ecb96f0fb94cc64370cd3d01a5c2d2bb.description: As a PubNub user I want to be able to get presence state associated with specific user identifier.

2d9b192cca7419c829a709b08c4a2f06.name: Signal user presence
2d9b192cca7419c829a709b08c4a2f06.description: As a PubNub user I want to be able to signal user presence on channels and groups. Client should be able to add presence state.

102f68ae159f97fa6e1bc8272ef0bae6.name: Get channels and groups presence
102f68ae159f97fa6e1bc8272ef0bae6.description: As a PubNub user I want to be able to check presence on channels and groups.

1eecb18ed355aa7aeffa00907735b9bf.name: Set presence state
1eecb18ed355aa7aeffa00907735b9bf.description: As a PubNub user I want to be able to associate presence state with specific user identifier.

56a3566ff98a5d205b39311dd479b541.name: Publish to Space
56a3566ff98a5d205b39311dd479b541.description: As a PubNub user I want to publish messages to Space with message type. Client should be able to pass optional spaceId and messageType to publish endpoint.

31e79e1a4e04e30eb7b299d55dc8d1f7.name: Publish a message
31e79e1a4e04e30eb7b299d55dc8d1f7.description: As a PubNub user I want to publish messages So I can use PubNub

a2732f84d2540a965fd29df847d1c3b0.name: Send a signal to Space
a2732f84d2540a965fd29df847d1c3b0.description: As a PubNub user I want to send some signals to Space with message type. Client should be able to pass optional spaceId and messageType to the signal endpoint.

085fea7abdc5d904fe69a3081efd7398.name: Signal
085fea7abdc5d904fe69a3081efd7398.description: As a PubNub user I want to send signals So I can implement features in my application?

31577c8a54813edae7252a078e710d11.name: Push Notifications
31577c8a54813edae7252a078e710d11.description: As a PubNub user I want to manage push notifications So I can communicate with my customers even when they are not using the application

3853114ae6230622b0724ef5c2f8df03.name: Subscribing to a channel automatically connects
3853114ae6230622b0724ef5c2f8df03.description: To make basic subscribe examples simpler, subscribing to a channel automatically connects to the server to receive messages.

ed865dcde7bceb38933da21bf045757b.name: Unsubscribing to all Channels automatically disconnects
ed865dcde7bceb38933da21bf045757b.description: If there are no active subscriptions, the SDK will disconnect from the PubNub service. Unsubscribing from the last subscription can be thought of as an Unsubscribe All operation.

84cb60a4b2d22e8a1f1b60b8d9c57c02.name: Automatic Reconnection
84cb60a4b2d22e8a1f1b60b8d9c57c02.description: After the SDK becomes disconnected, in some conditions, the SDK may schedule an automatic reconnection attempt. This may be done by scheduling a reconnect timer to require a delay before reconnecting or by requesting an immediate reconnect.

1fc98e7efd54aef1bcf026a7a2a69043.name: Check for Messages
1fc98e7efd54aef1bcf026a7a2a69043.description: Represents a single call to the subscribe api. For SDKs which do not have a subscribe loop May also be implemented in SDKs which do have a subscribe loop

4b48b3258ff3c38dfea73b816cf22460.name: Maximum allowed reconnection attempt configuration
4b48b3258ff3c38dfea73b816cf22460.description: The SDK can be configured at instance creation time to specify a Maximum number of reconnection attempts.

abb97f0b299e9e281651778e1575396b.name: Reconnection policy
abb97f0b299e9e281651778e1575396b.description: The SDK can be configured at instance creation time to specify a reconnection policy which determines the delay between reconnection attempts.

70791bbe139c7e7969ec6dc39345811d.name: Continuously receive messages
70791bbe139c7e7969ec6dc39345811d.description: The SDK can receive messages from the PubNub service and hand them off to the user's application. The messages will be delivered continuously using a technique known as long polling which involves repeatedly calling a subscribe api endpoint. This is known internally as "The subscribe loop" The ability to receive messages this way is known as being "connected." Connected refers only to the connection to PubNub and is not related to whether the network is connected. Making a subsequent subscribe api call is known as "reconnection" If reconnection is possible, the SDK is not considered "disconnected" "retry" will not be used to describe repeating subscribe calls and will only be used in association with transactional calls. "reconnect" will never be used in association with transactional calls. Receiving messages continuosly requires an automatic reconnection attempt. SDKs may also perform a manual reconnection attempt. Sometimes automatic reconnection attempts are not allowed. https://www.pubnub.com/docs/connections/connection-management For more information on status codes https://datatracker.ietf.org/doc/html/rfc7231#section-6.1

93d2a5de416a9faa342b3b52ff46571c.name: Subscribe Loop auto-retry with access denied
93d2a5de416a9faa342b3b52ff46571c.description: Test to ensure that clients won't try automatic retry when 403 received.

ceaa4b37fc9e2ca631d4c99bdd231ee8.name: Subscribe Loop
ceaa4b37fc9e2ca631d4c99bdd231ee8.description: Subscribe long polling with message published

85a6a2486a7b7deed8666fefb5ed581c.name: Delay between Automatic Reconnection Attempts
85a6a2486a7b7deed8666fefb5ed581c.description: To protect an overloaded server from the "Thundering Herd" problem, it is necessary to delay between reconnection attempts in response to failed communication. It is also helpful to limit the number of reconnection attempts via delays from the client side for billing and network usage reasons. A reconnection policy determines how long the SDK should wait before attempting an automatic reconnection after the last subscribe api call completed.

33bd81145c51e36419cb6ae4d8717295.name: Can stop receiving messages
33bd81145c51e36419cb6ae4d8717295.description: The developer can manually indicate they wish to stop checking for messages, but preserve subscription state to allow reconnecting later. This operation is known as manual "disconnect" After disconnecting, the SDK will report a connection status of disconnected. automatic reconnection attempts will not be allowed. automatic connection attempts will not be allowed. The only way to connect or reconnect is by mannually initiating a `reconnect` operation.

e8d2029f4b9e556281ab05e09de04882.name: Receiving a file event
e8d2029f4b9e556281ab05e09de04882.description: The SDK should receive a file event when other users have sent a file.

9e27e675110cf356753fb24432090889.name: Receiving a message event
9e27e675110cf356753fb24432090889.description: The SDK should receive a message event when other users have sent a message.

896307b1bed9e5bd8d5630edfbbd0f20.name: Receiving a message action added event
896307b1bed9e5bd8d5630edfbbd0f20.description: The SDK should receive a message action added event when other users set message actions

c35f178e8b121545c0db49fdb8e13d55.name: Receiving a message action event
c35f178e8b121545c0db49fdb8e13d55.description: The SDK should receive a message action removed event when other users delete message actions

536e7f5b942edcd2bb0667280abc4d94.name: Receiving a channel metadata removed event
536e7f5b942edcd2bb0667280abc4d94.description: The SDK should receive a channel metadata removed event when other users remove channel metadata

173a5a7e1c9ee9ab73a72041e1387796.name: Receiving a channel metadata set event
173a5a7e1c9ee9ab73a72041e1387796.description: The SDK should receive a channel metadata set event when other users set channel metadata

ffc5ff7fec04ba688cdefe40c7407ddf.name: Receiving a membership removed event
ffc5ff7fec04ba688cdefe40c7407ddf.description: The SDK should receive a membership removed event when other users remove memberships

342c0ab0bf912abf99eef41a2a56d586.name: Receiving a membership added event
342c0ab0bf912abf99eef41a2a56d586.description: The SDK should receive a membership added event when other users set memberships

ac812bda8bb79bca1b4caabefb64c837.name: Receiving a uuid metadata removed event
ac812bda8bb79bca1b4caabefb64c837.description: The SDK should receive a uuid metadata removed event when other users remove uuid metadata

7651c64e50fadcdac3691c0507ba39f5.name: Receiving a uuid metadata set event
7651c64e50fadcdac3691c0507ba39f5.description: The SDK should receive a uuid metadata set event when other users set uuid metadata

daba20e14b42ee46855cae69480f19e5.name: Presence events
daba20e14b42ee46855cae69480f19e5.description: The SDK should receive presence when other users have connected to a channel, disconnected from a channel or changed presence state. Presence can be configured in two differente modes 'announce' or 'interval'. The event contains an 'action' that is either 'join'/'leave'/'timeout' for 'announce' mode or 'interval' for 'interval' mode. The action field is also used to indicate 'state-change' events. For 'announce' mode the event will trigger individually for each UUID in a channel that is joining, leaving or changing state. For 'interval' mode the event will trigger at a set interval and do not include an individual UUID. If presence deltas are enabled the event will include a list of uuids that joined, left, timed out during that interval. Interval mode is automatically entered when the occupancy of the channel exceeds the Announce Max setting. here_now_refresh is a flag sometimes returned in 'interval' mode indicating that the presence message payload is over 30KB and the application developer will have call the hereNow() method in order to retrieve the details of who is present for a channel.

825e17780996f4f0d938449d8116998d.name: Receiving a join event
825e17780996f4f0d938449d8116998d.description: The SDK should receive a join event when other users have connected to a channel.

efb1e9ef17f55d6c9c4567ed08d8e613.name: Receiving a leave event
efb1e9ef17f55d6c9c4567ed08d8e613.description: The SDK should receive a leave event when other users have disconnected from a channel.

61bec27692421ab9d3858f8992e1ca43.name: Receiving a state change event
61bec27692421ab9d3858f8992e1ca43.description: The SDK should receive a state change event when other users have changed presence state.

ffd9a590eed0925aa23eaedbc952c426.name: Receiving a timeout event
ffd9a590eed0925aa23eaedbc952c426.description: The SDK should receive a timeout event when other users have not yet left a channel and have not sent a heartbeat in the expected time.

b757dc696cd4a4f94b8b4c9f998cfeb9.name: Receiving a signsal event
b757dc696cd4a4f94b8b4c9f998cfeb9.description: The SDK should receive a signal event when other users have sent a signal.

0529ef94add867a1c27802281e1bee68.name: Receiving a status event
0529ef94add867a1c27802281e1bee68.description: The SDK should receive a status event when the server includes status information

fb36d5c0af66cdad53d6c537dd7e01a5.name: Limit unsuccessful reconnection attempts
fb36d5c0af66cdad53d6c537dd7e01a5.description: To protect the server (or to batch receive messages) it may be useful to limit The number of unsuccessful reconnection attempts. This is part of the "Recconnection Policy". It is completely separate from retry attempts on transactional requests.

49a4cd6a615910fc88b7abf3fa43072f.name: Can trigger the SDK to receive messages
49a4cd6a615910fc88b7abf3fa43072f.description: Uses the existing state (timetoken and subsciptions) This operation is known as a manual "reconnect"

f2a5d70969c57bd2ae66139a8f1b509f.name: Restore Serialized Connection State
f2a5d70969c57bd2ae66139a8f1b509f.description: Restore connection state replaces the current state of the SDK with serialized state information

d76fe0c538901a8850e00130378d2582.name: Serialize Connection State
d76fe0c538901a8850e00130378d2582.description: Returns an opaque string which is suitable for serialization and which represents a subset of the state of the SDK. This is used to serialize the state of the SDK and restore it later after any unexpected interuption (like a force quit of the process)

c53f8be9cd8421dce302dfdaedcf9746.name: Get Connection Status
c53f8be9cd8421dce302dfdaedcf9746.description: The SDK will provide an operation that can be queried which will return the current connection state of the SDK This is intended to be primarily used for debugging and test writing.

8279f7f2d75407f881ce3cfa15a524b6.name: Inspect the number of subsequent failed reconnection attempts
8279f7f2d75407f881ce3cfa15a524b6.description: The SDK can be queried to determine how many sequential attempts to call the Subscribe REST API endpoint have failed. The number of failed attempts is only positive when the SDK is actively attempting to reconnect. If the SDK gives up on reconnecting, failed attempt count is reset to 0.

d5b5a1cc5e3b64ffd505e84d68539f25.name: Inspect automatic reconnection delay
d5b5a1cc5e3b64ffd505e84d68539f25.description: The SDK can be queried to determine how long of a reconnection delay will be used before the next automatic reconnection attempt. This is not a dynamic number in that it does not reflect current time until reconnection. This is intended to be primarily used for debugging and test writing.

b379e4ce371372b8d6b7ae225659030b.name: Get Subscribed Channel Groups
b379e4ce371372b8d6b7ae225659030b.description: The SDK can be queried to determine a list of the names of the channel groups that the SDK is subscribed to or will attempt to subscribe to. This is intended to be primarily used for debugging and test writing.

5504663e6c2324a25367b06043967260.name: Get Subscribed Channels
5504663e6c2324a25367b06043967260.description: The SDK can be queried to determine a list of the names of the channels that the SDK is subscribed to or will attempt to subscribe to. This is intended to be primarily used for debugging and test writing.

638f41460fe2b7e0022bdd92ab8e7df0.name: Get Subscription Cursor
638f41460fe2b7e0022bdd92ab8e7df0.description: A subscription cursor represents a point in time in a stream of messages. The subscription cursor is opaque, but internally is represented currently by a time token and region combination. This is intended to be primarily used for debugging and test writing.

4862b5407d890e3eb184e749e401cd0a.name: Subscribe for VSP
4862b5407d890e3eb184e749e401cd0a.description: As a PubNub user I want to subscribe and receive message type and space id information. Client should be able to receive message type and space id from subscribe response without any additional options set (like `includeMessageType` and `includeSpaceId` for other API).

a76d4ef5f3f6a672bbfab2865563e530.name: Time
a76d4ef5f3f6a672bbfab2865563e530.description: As a PubNub user I want to get current PubNub time So I can verify connectivity to the PubNub network

849.name: Listing push channels for APNS2 without topic
